About

I am Mahmoud Abumandour, a second-year Master of Science student at Simon Fraser University, supervised by Professor Alaa Alameldeen. I am interested in a wide spectrum of technologies from software systems to hardware and their interaction.

My current research concentration is securing deep learning applications running on edge devices against fault injection attacks.

Experience

Intel Corporation (Santa Clara, CA - Remote)

  • Graduate Intern - CPU Architecture (Jan ‘24 – Present)
    • Model and analyse the performance of features in the CPU fetch engine

Simon Fraser University (BC, Canada)

  • Research Assistant (Sep ‘22 – Present)
    • Assessed the impact of different attack vectors against quantized DNNs
    • Devised a fatal bit-flip attack against quantized DNNs and explored potential defenses
  • Teaching Assistant (Jan ‘23 – Dec 2023)
    • CMPT 295: Introduction to Computer Systems (Spring 2023)
    • CMPT 379: Principles of Compiler Design (Summer 2023)
    • CMPT 750: Computer Architecture (Fall 2023)

Google Summer of Code (Remote)

  • Software Developer - The RTEMS Organization (May '22 - Sep '22)
    • Used profiler-guided optimizations to achieve 8x performance improvement in the release generation process
    • RTEMS: Release Generator

Master Micro (Cairo, Egypt)

  • Software Engineering Intern (Oct '21 - Feb '22)
    • Designed and assessed the performance of two data storage schemes of the Design Database, the central data structure for storing design points.

Google Summer of Code (Remote)

  • Software Developer - The QEMU Organization (May '21 - Aug '21)
    • Implemented multicore cache emulation and performance evaluation of userspace and full-system workloads
    • QEMU: TCG Cache Modelling Plugin
